byline.contributor: Michael T. Kaufman, a correspondent and editor who covered Poland for The New York Times in the 1980s, died in 2010. Peter Keepnews contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Among Mr. Wajda’s best-known films are a war trilogy made in the 1950s, along with “Man of Marble” and its sequel, “Man of Iron.” He won an honorary Oscar in 2000.

headline.print_headline: Andrzej Wajda, Towering Auteur of Polish Cinema, Is Dead at 90
headline.main: Andrzej Wajda, Towering Auteur of Polish Cinema, Dies at 90

snippet: Among Mr. Wajda’s best-known films are a war trilogy made in the 1950s, along with “Man of Marble” and its sequel, “Man of Iron.” He won an honorary Oscar in 2000....
abstract: Andrzej Wajda, Polish film director best known for trilogy of works focused on history of Poland's wartime resistance, whose life's work earned him international acclaim, including honorary Oscar, dies at age 90.
